meanings.definition: To abuse or denounce in scurrilous language
meanings.sent1: He was blackguarding his opponent with mean words.
meanings.sent2: The bully was blackguarding the new student in the school yard.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about blackguarding his own reflection in the mirror.
meanings.sent4: Her sharp tongue was like blackguarding arrows piercing through the silence.
meanings.sent5: The angry customer was blackguarding the poor service he received at the restaurant.

meanings.sent1: The blackguarding thief was caught stealing from the store.
meanings.sent2: Everyone knew he was a blackguarding troublemaker in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat was a blackguarding feline, always causing chaos.
meanings.sent4: The blackguarding fox outsmarted all the other animals in the forest.
meanings.sent5: The pirate captain was a blackguarding leader, feared by all who crossed his path.
